articles.title: Pinterest sacks workers for creating tool to track layoffs - BBC
articles.description: The social media platform recently announced that it was axing around 15% of its workforce.

articles.title: Market Rotates Out Of Tech; Two Big AI Movers Late - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Consumer staples, regional banks, precious metals and industrials acting well.

articles.title: Washington's only Bahama Breeze restaurant to close - king5.com
articles.description: The Caribbean-themed chain announced it is closing all of its restaurants after 30 years in business, including one location in Washington.

articles.title: Asian Stocks Poised to Track US Tech-Led Selloff: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg
articles.description: Asian stocks pared earlier losses, following US tech shares’ drop, on speculation regional companies have a broader mix of operations that makes them more resilient to the software-driven selloff.

articles.title: Stephen Miran, Temporary Fed Governor, Resigns From White House Role - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Miran’s Fed seat is provisional after his term expired last month; Trump likely to fill vacancy with Fed Chair nominee Kevin Warsh

articles.title: Amazon delivers Seattle purge ahead of earnings - thestreet.com
articles.description: The e-commerce Goliath has made a hard-nosed decision.

articles.title: Senate Banking Democrats demand delay on Warsh nomination until Powell and Cook investigations end - CNBC
articles.description: Sen. Thom Tillis, R-N.C., has separately vowed to hold up the nomination until the DOJ resolves its criminal investigation of Fed Chair Jerome Powell.

articles.title: Netflix says users can cancel service if HBO Max merger makes it too expensive - Ars Technica
articles.description: 80 percent of HBO Max subscribers subscribe to Netflix, Sarandos tells Senate.

articles.title: Anthropic’s Move Into Legal Is Sinking Data Services Stocks - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Once again, artificial intelligence is dominating investors’ attention in the stock market. These days, however, the focus is turning more and more toward companies that may get disrupted by the new technology rather than those who stand to profit from it.

articles.title: Nvidia Nears Deal to Invest $20 Billion in OpenAI Round - Bloomberg
articles.description: Nvidia Corp. is nearing a deal to invest $20 billion in OpenAI as part of its latest funding round, according to people familiar with the matter, marking the chipmaker’s single biggest investment in the ChatGPT developer.

articles.title: Super Micro Computer Posts Higher Second-Quarter Profit on Two-Fold Sales Boost - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: The company logged a profit of $400.6 million, or 60 cents per share

articles.title: AMD Stock Drops Despite Beat-And-Raise Earnings Report - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Chipmaker AMD easily beat estimates for its fiscal fourth quarter and guided above views for the current period. But AMD stock fell.

articles.title: Signs Point To Continuity On Disney Movie Studio Side As Josh D’Amaro Moves Into CEO Role - Deadline
articles.description: What the Disney promotions of Josh D'Amaro and Dana Walden means for the future the movie studio.

articles.title: EPA Could Eliminate Limp Mode for Diesel Trucks Low on DEF - The Drive
articles.description: The federal agency is demanding failure and repair data from manufacturers to "hold [them] accountable for the continued system failures."

articles.title: Elon Musk is merging SpaceX and xAI to build data centers in space — or so he says - The Verge
articles.description: Elon Musk says he’s merging SpaceX with xAI to build data centers in space. But the billionaire has been known to combine profitable companies with debt-ridden, unprofitable ones.

articles.title: Chipotle stock sinks as restaurant chain reports falling traffic, weak guidance - CNBC
articles.description: Chipotle stock has fallen about 33% over the last year, dragging the company's market value down to about $51 billion.

articles.description: Here's what could happen to gold and silver next.

articles.title: Bitcoin tests $73,000, erasing gains since Trump's election night win - The Block
articles.description: A Glassnode analyst noted that 44% of the bitcoin supply is "now underwater," given that the token has dropped about 30% in the past month.

articles.title: Palantir Earnings Are 'A Warning to Peers' as Software Stocks Slump - Investopedia
articles.description: Palantir jumped Tuesday after the data analytics software company blew past earnings estimates, demonstrating there's hope for battered software stocks if companies can show investors tangible benefits from AI.
